name: Planters Inn on Reynolds Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have only positive views of this hotel. The room was bright and cheerful. The front desk service was crisp and effective. Daily cheese tray and a glass of wine in the lobby is a pleasant touch and enjoyable after a day of walking all over Savannah, a most beautiful city. Also the hotel is located on one of the historic squares for which Savannah is famous, a most convenient location from which to explore the city. All good!
reviews.title: A Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Planters Inn for two rainy days in February 2013. Had a room overlooking Reynolds Square-it was fantastic! The four poster bed was high off the floor and very comfortable. The expanded continental breakfast (included in the room rate) was tasty and filling-a good way to start the day. The hotel is centrally located. It was our base for two days of walking in the historic district. Many restaurants, museums, and squares were all within easy walking distance from the inn. We look forward to returning to the Planters Inn in the future.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Couldn't have asked for a betterr place to stay! Historic building completely updated with modern comforts, but without changing it's historical appeal! Attention to detail in mouldings and furnishings. Gorgeous flowers and cold strawberry water avaiable in lobby at all hours. Wine and cheese in the evening, buffet breakfast in the morning and warm cookies late at night were all delicious! Bellmen were always at the ready with sightseeing tips, and Karen helped with trips and restaurant recommendations! The beds were comfortable and the rooms kept clean by a helpful and couteous staff! Location within walking distance of everything in town!
reviews.title: Best Inn, Best Location, Best Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Planters Inn, Savannah, for 4 days. Our room was pleasant and the Inn is in a fabulous location in the historic district. There are many good restaurants within walking distance. However, we purchased the romantic package for which we paid $85 extra per night for two nights. This package was disappointing and misleading as we actually paid $170 for a carriage ride, a dozen roses, and a bottle of champagne. There was no expanded breakfast, as advertised nor nightly treats with the turn down service. If I had arranged the carriage ride, it would have cost $20 plus $5 for one more person. In addition, I had to remind the front desk that we had paid for the package. Therefore, I highly advise skipping the romantic package. Otherwise, the hotel was pleasant and in a great location.
reviews.title: Recent stay at Planter Inn, Savannah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked the Planters Inn. The staff was very helpful and friendly. It is a great location with plenty of restaurants near and lots of shopping in walking distance. The breakfast was okay but there was a great breakfast place, Henry's, just around the corner. I ended up getting sick and had to leave early but they were very gracious and did not charge us for the last night stay. I will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Love it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a bit reluctant to evaluate the Planter's Inn because we only spent a night there while in Savannah, just to give it a try for the next visit. I would certainly go back, largely due to the great location and, without a doubt, the staff. Starting with the staff first, I wound up chatting with the desk folks for five or ten minutes each time I went by them. They know Savannah and show that great Georgia hospitality. They also got their business done for other guests while chatting with me, and made the other guests feel special too.
reviews.title: Nice Place in a Very Nice City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel looks very historic and fits into the public square it abuts. There are 22 squares in downtown Savannah, including one recently reclaimed. It is a unique city because these squares seem to disperse traffic making it perhaps the best city to walk in the USA. This square, Reynolds Square, is one of the very nicest. So Planter's Inn is a great location, near the river and everything else in the Historic District.
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was reasonably nice but not super special. Impeccably clean, with a four poster and no run-of-the-mill hotel furniture, but not what I would call classic. Sort of modern reproduction furniture that looked like modern reproduction furniture. But it worked, and it fits the city and the square very nicely. Unfortunately, our room fronted the worst looking parking deck in Savannah. On the other hand, the public rooms are very nice, and the lobby is a classic. The room was very quiet at night.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing that stands out, given the public rooms and the location, is it is a huge bargain. We were not there on a super special, and to get such nice accommodations in such a great location and great staff was a real surprise. I don't give many five star reviews because I think people aren't helpful when they rank just any decent place five stars. To me, this is a solid four on the Tripadvisor scale. I would happily return.
reviews.title: Another Fantastic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Savannah...loved the southern hospitalty and "laid-back" pace of the city. Planter's Inn is the perfect place to stay in the historic district...we had a room with a small balcony that we could listen to the music in Reynolds Square every night...staff was very personable and took very good care of us...loved the breakfast buffet and wine and cheese every evening...beautifully decorated room with a very comfortable bed and all the amenities we needed. Plenty of restaurants, shopping and attractions within walking distance...we loved not having to move our car during our three day stay...only negative was that we had to leave, but we definitely will be back.
reviews.title: Southern Hospitality
Nice building, location, people, room
reviews.text: Great location right on a beautiful square and close to Leopold's Ice Cream, not far from coffee and much else on Broughton Street. Hospitable staff. Bright and comfortable room. Looked out at a parking garage though. Would stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Planters in very close to all the action, yet it's in a quiet area. It's a short walk to the riverfront area. There are many lovely parks and gardens near by. The hotel staff was very nice. When we return to Savannah we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: They go out of there way to make you feel at home. I just could not get over how nice everyone was. As and example. I was looking for a place to workout and the concierge provided me with directions but I could not find the place. I went back to the hotel and the desk manager actually walked me to the location three blocks away. Wow
reviews.title: Nice hotel with exceptional service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not exactly happy with this booking, hence it took this long to write a review…
reviews.title: In the Heart of Savannah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We booked a room at the Planter’s Inn in Savannah, Georgia in December. We were on my Birthday Week Vacation. This place was listed in the Snique Away website and thought it would be a good thing. Since we have never been in Savannah, we didn’t know what to expect. Our room consisted of a bed and two wooden chairs…plus a bathroom. It’s a good thing the bed was quite high off of the ground, so I could store our suitcases there. We did have cable t.v. The nightly wine-cheese event was nice, but sparse. We did meet some very nice travelers at this event though.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Savannah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at the Planters Inn. We were there Oct 1 through Oct 3. One down note was the pushiness of the conceirge at the Wine and Cheese reception. She literally was dismissive and rude if you didn't want to book a tour. She also was extremely rude to me when I asked for a wine refill and gave me half a glass. If you are limited to one glass then that should be stated up front.
reviews.title: Planters Inn Savannah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: I would stay at the Planters Inn again, she was the only down side. All other staff met or exceeded our expectations. The location is great to go anywhere in the historic district.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Didn't see any ghosts (and we were happy about that)!
reviews.title: Charming Savannah Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went for a weekend trip and stayed based on a friend of a friend's recommendation. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Location was perfect for us as we were able to walk to everywhere we wanted and come back to this location which was central to all of our visits. We too had a view of the parking garage but I didn't plan on staring out the window during a trip to Savannah so it didn't bother us and was not that horrible of a view as.others have complained. Would recommend to anyone. Great stay.
reviews.title: Southern Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Savannah and I picked the Planters Inn by reviews that I had read and the location. I could not have chosen a better place. Being right on Reynolds Square added to the charm and they have a lovely wine reception in the evening along with a breakfast buffet in the morning. The room was very clean, had an evening turndown service and ice was brought to your room every afternoon. The staff is very friendly and helpful...Great location and easy walking distance to all Savannah has to offer. I would definitively stay there again.
reviews.title: Great stay in Savannah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Savannah to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and stayed at the Plantars Inn - the Inn was just lovely and every staff member we met was cheerful, helpful and accommodating - our room was spotless when we arrived and was kept that way our entire stay. The Inn parks your car for you with a separate fee of approx. $15 per day and when we wanted to retrieve our car there was virtually no wait time to get it. One of the things we enjoyed the most about the Inn was the wine and cheese social held each evening, giving us a chance to wind down and chat with other people staying at the Inn. Another nice touch, was when the concierge found out that it was our anniversary, she sent a bottle of Champagne to our room with the Inn's complements...The only thing I can say that could use some improvement was the breakfast. Breakfast is included with the stay and is a buffet style. It includes cold cereals, breads and rolls, fruit, yogurt, grits and hard boiled eggs. Coffee and juice is also available. The food was mediocre at best. That being said, we did take advantage of the breakfast each morning, as it was included and were grateful that there was anything available. All in all, I would recommend this property, but did feel that it was a bit over priced.
reviews.title: Beautiful place in a beautiful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights. The room was lovely, although the entire window looked out onto a multi level parking garage. The bathroom was lovely and large if somewhat dimly lit. However, there were a number of issues which marred our stay. One was the 40 minute wait my husband had in our double parked car for valet parking - I think the hotel was particularly busy with guests checking in for a wedding but... if you know that's the case, maybe have more than one valet? We then ordered a room service breakfast which was completely inedible and had clearly been lying around for some time - lukewarm coffee etc and only arriving after 3 separate calls to reception when it was late. They at least refunded us the room service charge but this was a disappointment. It's a shame - I think if the hotel had not been so very busy or if the reception staff had been empowered to make things right rather than just appearing out of their depth this could have been a nice stay. Lovely city but would not recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice room, shame about the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: an expensive hotel that did not deliver the goods in my opinion.
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Breakfast juice served in a plastic beaker, in a windowless room with not enough tables
reviews.title: Excellent choice for a beautiful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: for the number of residents when I was there.There was no residents lounge, I was told to go outside and sit in the square when I wanted some fresh air, the lobby was not an option as it was too small and can be busy. the cheese and wine reception would have been nice had there been a spare chair for me. the location is good, the staff are charming but for the money charged it
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The central location of the Inn was convenient for walking all over the city. The staff were very professional, courteous, and helpful. The room was a good size and was clean. The breakfast provided sustenance but was not special (cereal, bagels, fruit, danish, coffee). My room faced Congress Ln and it was noisy from 7am to 11pm. I recommend the Inn for both the business and pleasure traveler.
reviews.title: A good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really cannot say enough good things about The Planters Inn. This was our second trip to Savannah and hopefully we will return for a third. The city and its' residents are wonderful, everyone is most helpful and friendly. We enjoyed every minute at the Planters Inn, from the plentiful breakfast (with it's very personable hostess) to the beautiful wine and cheese reception every day, to the absolutely spotless room and bath. The employees on the desk were more than friendly every day, always there to help with any and all needs. The location with proximity to both River St. and the City Market couldn't be better. We sat in Reynolds Square every night and enjoyed the beautiful surroundings.
reviews.title: A Perfect Week
Absolutely wonderful!!
reviews.text: I would agree with other comments on the unsightly parking garage next door, but it's certainly nothing that cannot be helped by simply closing the draperies! We did experience some outside "night noise" over the weekend, but again....it can be easily ignored.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this charming historic hotel, don't hesitate.
reviews.title: 95% of rooms face tall, ugly parking garage, so NO views
Skip the breakfast & go to Henry's around the block
reviews.text: We spent only one night here but have already promised ourselves a return visit, next time for several days. The location is just about perfect for exploring old Savannah. Our room was splendid: clean, very comfortable, and luxurious. Even the wine and cheese greeting on our arrival and the breakfast were terrific. Great place, wonderful staff...stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Myself along with three girlfriends had a fantastic stay at the Planters Inn with great concierge service, front desk service, nice clean rooms and comfortable beds ( which is a bonus ). Breakfast is great with many items to choose from ( perfect to start your day ). Location was awesome being central located and only a few blocks from the river, everything was with in walking distance. Early evening was social hour in the lobby with a large tray of assorted cheese, fruit, crackers and Wines, this was a nice way to meet and greet others and start your evening. I would highly recommend Planters Inn.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in Savannah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Savannah where we stayed at the Planter's Inn. We had a great time and very happy with our choice to stay here. We specifically liked the great location (central location just a few blocks from most attractions) and also the great service from the staff at the Inn. Our bellhop Tanner was helpful and worked hard to help us with whatever we needed. He brought us Champagne on our first night since it was our anniversary (very nice touch). The lady at the front desk was friendly and gave great suggestions for places to eat and other things to do.
reviews.title: Nice Inn, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall we were very happy we chose this location and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Savannah in the Spring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well located hotel, good size rooms and quiet. The views from the guest rooms on the east side are not great, but that is not the fault of the hotel. Breakfast room needs improvements in décor and number of tables to serve guests when the hotel is full. I found the staff very helpful, especially the concierge at the evening wine hour. For the price, very reasonable for Savannah this is a good place to stay.
reviews.title: Nice room, good location, horrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice room and clean. great location over looking the square. Hard to find parking in the area and we were rushed into deciding on valet, which you have to pay extra for. Do not bother asking for a map of the historic district and they are kinda blinded on recommending just three activities.
reviews.title: Savannah trip for our anniversary
Great Stay
reviews.text: Stayed at the Planter's Inn for four nights. Couldn't have been more pleased! Staff was very friendly and accommodating--especially the concierge, Karen. She sat with us the first day and made all of our reservations for restaurants and theater. Continental breakfast buffet with friendly staff. Cocktail reception in lobby each day from 5:30 to 7:30. Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was a nice change from a traditional hotel stay. Nice clean room, although the bathroom is a little dark. Wonderful wine reception in the evening! Loved the warm cookies each night! There isn't a fitness facility on-site, but you can use one a short walk from the Inn. It was a little subpar, but served its purpose. The staff were amazing and very helpful! Not a huge fan of the breakfast. You must eat at The Olde Pink House before leaving!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was excellent! We were very well taken care of and will stay there again. Located on Reynolds Square, very convenient to all we wanted to do. Excellent breakfast and the warm cookies at night were so good!
reviews.title: Loved the Planters Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: We stayed at Planters for the second time Sept 17-21. The location is great and it is a beautiful hotel. The ladies that serve the continental breakfast were the sweetest ladies ever! We loved the wine reception every evening. We did have one problem that was a little unnerving. We left our room one morning at 9:00am and didn't return until six that evening and upon return the door to our room was open. We went in cautiously and checked to see if anything had been taken. Luckily, everything was fine. We assumed that more than likely housekeeping had cleaned our room and had not shut the door. I was quite upset because we were only lucky that nothing was taken by any passers-by that may have noticed an open door. I called the front desk to let them know my frustration and they just said "sorry, we'll let the manager know." Nothing else was ever said to us regarding this situation. Other than that we had a pleasant stay and will most likely return.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is definitely recommended if you plan on touring the beautiful city of Savannah. It is located at Reynolds Square, only two blocks from River Street, and within walking distance of Forsythe Park. All of the employees were cordial, and helpful. Included daily with our stay was a continental breakfast, wine and cheese early evening, and freshly baked cookies at the end of the night. We would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Planters Inn, Savannah, GA

aka: Planters Inn On Reynolds Square Hotel Savannah
description: To sleep in the epicenter of the city's beautiful historic district, book some time here, on Reynolds Square. The Planters Inn offers elegant rooms, great service, and a jovial wine and cheese reception where people linger each afternoon. For a view, ask about one of the rooms overlooking Reynolds Square Park. Better yet, step outside the inn and get lost among the azaleas and architecture. Just make it back for your dose of wine and cheese.
